metadata.name: Remote XSL Execution Via Msxsl.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects the execution of the "msxsl" binary with an "http" keyword in the command line. This might indicate a potential remote execution of XSL files.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\msxsl.exe')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('http')))

output.summary: Detects the execution of the "msxsl" binary with an "http" keyword in the command line. This might indicate a potential remote execution of XSL files.

metadata.objective: False positive: Msxsl is not installed by default and is deprecated, so unlikely on most systems. References: https://github.com/redcanaryco/atomic-red-team/blob/f339e7da7d05f6057fdfcdd3742bfcf365fee2a9/atomics/T1220/T1220.md, https://lolbas-project.github.io/lolbas/OtherMSBinaries/Msxsl/
